Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Convenient, but just OK.”
Reviews.Author: RobbTob
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for reasonable accommodations in SanDiego, then Goon Nite Inn might be the perfect place. The rooms are clean enough. The beds are old. Free Parking (park in underground garage, it doesn't get so jammed packed). The internet is hit and miss.

Reviews.Title: “Ok For A Quick Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PoopyCampo
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego to go fishing occasionally, and usually stay at this Good Nite Inn. If I'm visiting for any other reason, I prefer a different property. The Good News - This 2-story property is within 15 minutes of Sea World, close to the older Sports Arena venue, and within 5 minutes of San Diego's Old Town. The rooms are generally clean, showers with tubs, Wireless Internet (separate charge), small refrigerators in the rooms, and during the day, parking is plentiful. There is coffee in the morning, but no breakfast. A Denny's Restaurant is immediatly across the driveway. I've stayed here for years, and again, for an inexpensive quick stay, I'd recommend the property. The (Not So Good) News - While others comment on plentiful parking, you might find the upper lot totally filled at night. There is underground parking, but I don't consider it safe to walk up to ground level if you're alone. This property does not always get the best clientele. Over the years, I've seen the Police there a few times. Less so in the last 2 years, however. The hotel is adjacent to a slightly unsavory area, and yes, there is a strip club and adult store around the corner (Mostly out of sight). Families do stay here, but like anywhere, keep your eyes open in the late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: TSZE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in January - we picked this hotel because it had a very good location (close to Old Town - it was 10 minutes even by walk, close to Seaworld, Mission Beach and access to the highways). They have a big parking lot which you are free to use. Our room was on the ground floor, room was big and clean (the carpet wasn't the best though). Bathroom was fine. There wasn't any problem with the neighbourghood, we often walked to the pharmacy and to close shops even at night. The only problem was that the walls were like they weren't there so sometimes we heard very word from the parking lot (one night it was really loud). Staff was kind, no complaints. We usually left in the morning and arrived late at night so it was perfect to rest, we haven't missed the amenities. The one wierd thing is that they charge you for a deposit (20$ I guess...) and they transfer it back in 5-6 days... Don't let negative comments dissapoint you, surely it is not a hotel for a family vacation to rest but if you are in SD to explore it's the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Anacortes42
Reviews.Content: My 2 kids & I stayed here for 5 days on vacation. The room was clean and suited us well. Customer service was great and I do appreciate good customer service! It was a bit noisy in the back, but I have stayed in worse. Hot water never seemed to run out which is a bonus when there are 3 people in a room. Dennys was right across the street, and the freeway on ramps were very close. Alot of places to eat in the area including an In n Out, Chili's, Red Lobster, and Phil's B-B-Q, old town is close and a neat place to visit, Seaworld is right around the corner too. People criticize the strip clubs being close but you'd never know it by the activity around the place, we never saw anyone around it. I just wonder why it smelled like marijuana smoke in the stairwell and near the other rooms.....

Reviews.Title: “***Stay Here If You Are Vacationing in San Diego***”
Reviews.Author: lmckiddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful. I always saw maintenance keeping on top of things. They just remodeled a lot of room. I'm a single mom traveling with a kid and I felt safe here. The hotel is full of vacationers and construction workers who need a place to stay and they all go home on the weekends to their families. The parking is free. The wireless internet is $4.95 for 24 hours. I paid $120 for 3 nights ($40/night). WOW !!! Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Granite countertop in the bathroom. Nice tile too !!! Plenty of hot water. This hotel is near Seaworld, Old Town, Mission Beach, Baywalk, Little Italy, Seaport Village, Gaslamp Quarter, San Deigo Zoo, and Balboa Park. Within walking distance is every major store and restaurant you could ever want. My son loved the Chuck E Cheese and Laser Tag Zone that was two blocks away. I highly recommend this place. You will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but more importantly didn't feel safe”
Reviews.Author: Joannelips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my boyfriend as we were passing through San Diego... we just didn't feel safe at all, there's an in n out burger bar 3 minute walk away & we got stopped 4 times on the way there & back by beggars/drugged up people etc following us.. location is dodgy so beware.. room was fine, very basic but ok for one night's sleep if a bit cold & smelt damp, but was very cheap.. shower very good.. we hired a Camaro as it was my bf's birthday & we saw from our window some guy looking into it on the phone to someone- may have been nothing but didn't help when we were already feeling unsafe.. don't go to Dennys next door - food was so greasy & eggs weren't cooked!.. close to highway so quite loud!

Reviews.Title: “Beware before booking unfortunately I can't rate it lower”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie P
Reviews.Content: We were given a 2 night stay for going to a vacation time share presentation and this where they put us!!! Checked in and checked out 14 minutes later... Went next door to the Hampton inn. This Good Nite Inn room stunk, dirty stained carpet, pillows looked like they got them out of a garbage can, saw bullets in the parking lot next to our car on the ground, and unsafe environment at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Really basic lodging”
Reviews.Author: TGDiva
Reviews.Content: The property is very good as far as like location to major attractions in San Diego. That's THE upside. There are many downsides though. Upon checkin it was discovered that the AC/Heat was not functioning as it was actually like raining that day and a little chilly. The room phone also didn't work, I could hear the front desk but they could not hear me. After about three attempts I called on my cell phone. After the fellow sent up to fix it obviously couldn't, I requested and received another room. Thank gawd we hadn't yet unpacked. These rooms have like one tiny 2 ft long clothes hanging area (not really sufficient for two girls and three nites), 3 drawer TV/wardrobe combo and only 1 of those folding thingies to set your suitcase on, a super small bath counter with no space for anything (think $69.00 Home Depot vanity for your remodeled basement), and I had to set my suitcase on the top shelf of the hanging area unless I wanted to like live on the floor. We were literally using the top of the TV cabinet, the desk, the refrigerator and wutever had a top surface to place stuff. I'm talkin' just basic stuff here folks. Wut a so totally waste of space in a otherwise large room. The whole place is way past it's heyday and sorta tired and needs much TLC. It had a eewww factor of about 5. I noticed the second room had a newer AC/Heat unit as well as a few cosmetic upgrades. I always request the upper floor, it keeps the stomping elephants above, running drains and all other wutever if on lower floors at night at bay lol, so elevators are important. There is a almost empty underground parking area that is only accessible from the far back end of the property, the front entrance is gated and locked. However it did enable us to like park right next to the elevator as the other is handicapped. The only problem is it's on one end of the long building and not in the middle. Go figure? There are ice and soda machines in the center of the building on only the first 2 levels, but not the third one. Instead there are washers and dryers, I don't know why not a ice machine? Again, although in the middle still a long walk to the connecting stairs and down a floor for some ice. Maybe we just hit it wrong but the first nite (of three) there were a bunch of younger guys, like 15 total or wutever, a few who were very loud and partying, might have ended up at one of the strip clubs next door, ok one block away, and returned about 2:15 AM loud enough and shouting to wake us up. We complained the next day and maybe something was like mentioned to the group leader, it was considerably toned down the next night. The morning "compliments" consisted of lobby coffee and nothing else, which seemed strange as the Chula Vista property also offers orange juice as well as assorted muffins. It's a hard place to exit from onto Rosecrans St as I-8 dumps cars off the freeway still winding down from wut seems like 65-70 MPH making it hard to pull out in a slim lull and get out of the right turn lane only down the road to the signal light. Got a few horns and fingers, I just nicely waved back as they like cursed my Arizona plate I'm sure lol. The short of this though, if you don't mind the little extra distance like 10 freeway minutes south to Chula Vista, use THAT property. It's like a few bucks cheaper, has a MUCH nicer well kept atmosphere w landscaping, larger and nicer clothes storage and hanging areas, much larger bath counters for makeup and wutever and a pool as well as morning muffins, right off the E street exit and still no freeway noise. Much better bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great price and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Stewart T
Reviews.Content: Was here for a 3 day stay. Room was clean and comfortable with a good shower and the staff were very helpful when I had any enquiries about using public transportation to get to Seaworld and the zoo (both were easily accessible by bus from the hotel). The neighbourhood is a little remote, but then we spent all our days at attractions anyway so this wasn't an issue. Denny's across the road was handy for a stock-standard breakfast/dinner. We chose this hotel purely and simply for its price and ended up being very satisfied with it overall. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Great price!!”
Reviews.Author: cherryteddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for one night. It was good for the price. Location was good if going to Sea World but a liitle far for downtown. This hotel was not in a very good location in town. Nudey bar acrossed the street, but staff was very friendly and we were able to park under then hotel so I felt my car was safe. The interior of hotel okay for a budget hotel sheets were nice and room was clean but front door a little sketchy. old locks. room definately needs to be updated but otherwise okay for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: DavidPlate
Reviews.Content: We stay here regularly. They have some weird corporate rules, such as a $25 deposit for damage to the room, but the rooms are clean and quiet. Strongly recommend against the Chula Vista property... they have terrible security issues there, even with the "Barney Fife" security guard who patrols the property 24/7. Great new bathroom and wonderful staff. Contrary to MLBBaseballTraveller, who is wrong, they have both hair dryers and irons... just ask the front desk staff...Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlbbaseballtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. Its a hotel where you get what you pay for. The blanket on the bed had hairs on it but the room and bathroom was clean. The front desk employees were all very nice and willing to help. There aren't any hair dryers or any other great amenities but is an ok hotel for staying a couple nights. The tv worked but had lines running through it and made sounds, better than nothing. I will give the housekeeping ladies an A+ because they were working hard and were there to help when needed. Plenty of parking and the hotel is close enough to things. Overall, I wouldn't stay here long but an ok place to stay for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Room was clean”
Reviews.Author: randykay10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK and the room was clean but it is in a creepy part of town. Didn't like the location. Other than that it was ok. Definitely recommend that when visiting San Diego you spend a day on the San Diego Trolley Tour. The best way to see all the important points of interest in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Simply THE Best Hotel in the entire San Diego area...Here's why:”
Reviews.Author: Jed L
Reviews.Content: This place has huge clean rooms, well kept, friendly attentive staff, the absolute LOWEST rates I could find anywhere, and central to anything and everything. In town for 6 weeks on a corporate job...constantly hopping around from one crappy place to the next...until I found this place. Right next to Hampton Inn which is more than TRIPLE the rate with almost the exact same rooms!! Why would I pay triple the rate for the same size room, number of beds, and same quality?? Denny's right across the street...$2 breakfast. Target, CVS, Walgreens, right around the corner...right next to freeway. You won't find a better place to stay in San Diego. Only thing this place doesn't have is free breakfast...but I hate muffins anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Michele B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to Sea World. That is the only positive thing that I can say about this hotel...it was very close to Sea World. The room was gross! It smelled like urine, it looked dirty, the carpets were so worn that there were practically holes in it. The bathroom was dirty too. I was uncomfortable letting my children even sit on the comforters on the bed. Thank goodness that we arrived in the late afternoon and really only had to sleep in the room and wake up and leave. I would not recommend this place. It was way over priced for such a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret W
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is that it is near the major highways- so you can make a quick get away from this filthy place. Oh where to even begin... 1. Parking = nightmare 2. Homeless people wandering about all day and night 3. Room smelled damp and moldy - turns out this was due to the fact that the entire base board of the wardrobe in the room (#131) was ROTTING OUT from apparent water damage. Mold galore. 4. BIG carpet stains 5. White bath tub floor now stained a light brown 6. Strip clubs EVERYWHERE! 7. Mattress springs could be felt through the bed 8. 1/2 the channels were static In summery, just pay an extra $20 and get a hotel that won't threaten to give you lice or lung cancer

Reviews.Title: “PRICE HIKED AT CONVENTION TIME”
Reviews.Author: Gary_El
Reviews.Content: Room was ok , location fine , staff a bit off – we sat for 45 minutes in reception as check-in was after 2 pm – all of a sudden after 2 , the rooms are cleaned and ready to let . The reason this hotel is only getting two stars is the price hike they ( and , to be fair , most others in the area ) charged all because our stay happened to coincide with comic con 2011 . What I would have classed as a very average $50 a night room cost three times as much .

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: vom098
Reviews.Content: I read a lot about this hotel before we went. My girl friend was optimistic and wanted to try it regardless of the reviews I told her about that I read on this very site. Needless to say, the negative reviews are all correct. Parking - the parking in this facility is absolutely terrible. Extremely small and you can never find a parking when you come back at night. They offer addtional parking underground, but it is anything but convenient. Service - The Lobby personnel are terrible. Management was very disrespectful to my girl friends parents when they had issues with accessing their room. Both of our refrigerators in our rooms never worked. When we called to complain, they said nothing could be done about it. So don't plan on having a working refrigerator. Laundry - it is on the 3rd floor outside and there are only 2 of each at $1.25 each. No soap is sold or offered anywhere. Room - the room had a musty smell to it. Our couch had stains. As I mentioned previously, our refrigerator did not work. Half of our wall did not have any lights or outlets working. Basically, no power. We never called to complain, we just dealt with it. Everything else worked. Noise - I read a lot here about the thin walls, folks, don't think that's a lie. I thought we could cope, but this was the worst I have experienced by far. You could hear every single person that walks by and it is almost if there feet were amplified. You can hear everytime anyone's door who is remotely around your room. You can hear when your neighbors shower as well. My girl friend slept horribly. The maids - the maids kept the room clean. No complaints about them. Location- althought this may be close to sea world, don't let that sell you. It is in the ghetto. Very bad area. Bums everywhere. So bad that they do not have an open lobby at night. You have too talk through them through a glass window. They also have security all night which depending on how you look at it, could be a positive. There is a strip club right next to the hotel. I would not recommended this hotel anyone. Even though it is cheap, you get what you pay for. We stayed July 24rd - July 27th 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2teens
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, about half of what other hotels were charging, it was not a bad room. Beds were ok, and the location is close (driving) to Sea world, beaches, ect. The rooms are average sized, not cramped and smelled clean. Just a small warning there is a bussiness named the Body Shop (adult strip club) across the street with signs. Although they and their clients seemed to keep their distance from the hotel. The parking is a nightmare. If you just need a cheap place to sleep then this is a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Scary location and not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: 2006michelle1970
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE unless you are looking to score crack or hook up with a stripper from the strip bar across the street. We booked this hotel not knowing the location and liked the price. We had booked 3 nights and stayed 1. The only night we stayed we got no sleep for fear that someone was going to break into our room since the dead bolt was ripped off our door and the strip bar across the street and people of questionable backgrounds hanging out outside our door all night. We ended up checking out and staying at a different hotel the last 2 nights. Strongly advise not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Krissy808
Reviews.Content: After reading horrible reviews we were worried to stay here. However, we had a great stay. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was clean and safe - remember this is an old hotel so it's a bit worn. However it's cheap, and close walk to old town and trolley. It is near a strip club - however we had no issues with people around the area. Would stay again. Thanks to the staff who made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: MonikaFabianska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only wanted a bed to sleep in but we felt very gross in the room. The sheets were stained yellow and pillows were dirty. If you have a car it was a close location to the airport and downtown but I would not stay again because the beds were dirty. We also had to pay a $15 deposit for a hair dryer and iron which we got back if we returned end of our stay. Looks like its often stolen because the hotel is mainly occupied by college kids. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Travelers2222
Reviews.Content: We were very suspicious of the low cost, we even had friends who visited this Inn a month before give us there opinion. I can say that the staff was excellent, the room was clean, and because of the low cost, [$39.00 a night weekdays~senior] the Inn was full every night. The location is in a busy area but there are plenty of places to eat and easy access to I-5 & I-8. It is not a five star hotel but you do get a clean room and your money's worth! We stayed six nights if Feb. and three nights in Mar at the end of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pleasant stay - near Old Town Transit center and Sea World”
Reviews.Author: mares889
Reviews.Content: Nice low-budget hotel and nice & helpful staff. Room was clean and very big (we actually got a 4 sleep room). Came a day earlier and had no problem getting a room for even a lower price. We have been using MTS public transport (10 min walk from hotel to Old Town Transit center --> a day fare: 5$ per person - unlimited). The only bad thing about this hotel we discovered is that there is no free internet access (24h --> 5$).

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel In San Diego By Far”
Reviews.Author: miguelmaul
Reviews.Content: Everything was horrible/terrible from the start the front desk clerk could not speak english right I was just glad I had already made my reservations online. Has soon has me and my spouse started walking towards our room we noticed two teenagers breaking into a room through the window through the window saw us and ran away next we were not even to our room and there was and african male running out of a room without shoes and shirt drunk and on some sort of narcotics screaming all sorts of foul language. Next we entered our roomm and it smelled like old urine, the shower tub had excessive mold, and the television did not work. I tried freshing up the room using my car freshener and my cologne but the smelll would not go away at that point we got fet up and went to go talk to the manage which took her time to help us out and first had to go inspect the room for herself which came out to be that we were telling the truth because she had nothing to say and just refunded me completely. But it did take her more than an hour for her to inspect the room all of this happen at around 1030 PM after we had been traveling all day on the highway and we were just looking for a place to stay and rest for the night. By far this is the worst customer service and hotel I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for :)”
Reviews.Author: GonzaleParty3
Reviews.Content: The place is not all that bad. You have everything nearby, which is great!! The strip clubs are like a block away, and you cant even tell they are there from the hotel, really the only way you know they are their is because you have to drive by them a block down (with all SD's one way streets).Their are no obvious prostitutes running around, nor drug deals. The hotel is located in an industrial type setting. I will definately stay again if the prices stay this affordable. I'm sure the reviews on here that were bad are just high maintenance people. I do have to agree with the lack of toilette paper, we only had a little but the maid was more then happy to help out when asked. Also the security guard was a crack up, it was his first day and he didn't know anything, so for entertainment my husband and i kept asking him questions and joking around with him. The last thing was when we arrived late, there were no more front parking spaces and our high truck wouldn't fit in the garage, but the manager came out and was so friendly and awesome, and gave us VIP parking, well let us park in a great spot. Hope my review helps. I would recommend this to friends an family, and stay here again with my son and husband :)

Reviews.Title: “filthy, and we have pictures to prove it, & completely blown off when we contacted them through the survey card”
Reviews.Author: BARBIE5949
Reviews.Content: filthy, begging for towels everyday, cable box hanging from the wall, filthy & stained carpeting, dust bunnies on light fixtures, no toilet tissue, had to keep going to the office for more, there was 4 of us in the room. We didnt leave the energy card on the bed, which meant we wanted our linen changed daily, and it was not, sent our survey card in several weeks ago, & got no response, we feel completely furious, & completely blown off, as if we didnt matter, NO WE WONT EVER RECOMMEND THIS MOTEL TO ANY OF OUR FAMILY OR FRIENDS, & WE ARE TELLING THEM WHAT WE WENT THROUGH, & HOW WE DIDNT GET ANY RESPONSE, WHAGTSO EVER.bbb is next.

Reviews.Title: “Room was given to someoneelse"”
Reviews.Author: shirodkar
Reviews.Content: Most terrible experience! even though we had reservation through expedia we arrived late night, our room was given to someone, we ended up sleeping in the car overnight with 2 children it was terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good expierence”
Reviews.Author: nmesserli
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this place for our trip to sea world. It was very close to sea world which I loved, especially for the price. When we got there I was less then thrilled. The place seemed a bit sketchy, strip clubs, "adult arcades" and sex shops are all right near it. Checking in was easy and the girl at the front desk, Ava, was sweet. Parking was odd, there was one car in the underground parking so we didn't know if we should park down there, and one side of the garage was locked. We parked in the regular lot and had to walk around to the backside for our room, whatever. Room was very basic, the bathroom was nothing great at all, very small, small shower, small counter, no blow dryer. Room smelled like bleach...which to me shows they clean, so I was okay with that. Sheets weren't disgusting, and the bed was decent. I'm really picky about beds and sheets and I slept just fine here. The curtains I hated, I feel like most hotel rooms have two sets of curtains, black out ones as well as ones that go all the way from one side to the other. This didn't, there were two panels that came together, so, there was a space between them. I had to try and overlap them to get privacy since I definetely could not get dressed in the too small bathroom. Besides minor things though, the room was okay, cable was appreciated and they had lots of menus for delivery. Checking out this morning was easy and the woman at the front desk mailed something for me. Would definetely stay again if I come to sea world.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE STAY GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DelgadoFam
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip to San Diego to visit Sea World, The San Diego Zoo and to take our three year old son to see the awesome beaches! We booked our stay at this hotel despite the reviews. I really don't know why the bad reviews! My family and I thought the hotel was pretty decent especially for the price and the location! When we arrived check in was very easy. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. When we got to our rooms (my brother and his girlfriend stayed in a separate room) they were both very clean. There were clean towels, the beds were made and the bathroom was clean in both of the rooms. We were there four nights and we slept very comfortably. It's no five star hotel but its clean comfortable and located near a lot of San Diego's big attractions. Denny's gave us a good discount on our meals and they are located just across the street! If you are just looking for a place to sleep and rest this is a great place and we would definitely stay here again! The strip bar thing is not a big deal its all the way down the street and not an issue. We did not see any suspicious activity and it appeared to be a very safe place. I hope my review is helpful to you and enjoy your trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Good nite, bad everything else”
Reviews.Author: SactoGamer
Reviews.Content: At least I was able to get some sleep. That's about the only thing I could say good about this place. Visiting San Diego to catch a Padres game, my father and I checked into this Goot Nite Inn, which is comfortably close to the Old Town metro stop, expecting to have a standard moderate-quality motel experience. It was apparant as soon as we stepped into what barely passes as a lobby that we were't going to get that. After a somewhat stressful check-in experience (the desk clerk had trouble finding our reservation) we were given our room. While walking to our room, which was on the backside of the building, we were greeting by the scene of a homeless man urinating in the plants. That kind-of set the mood for the rest of this motel experience. The room was bare-bones basic with an underwhelming bathroom. It felt less like a name-brand motel and more like either a bad dorm room or a nice-ish prison cell -- take your pick. The bed wasn't very comfy (it was rather stiff) but at least I was able to get a little shut-eye after the game. It was a good thing that we only had the one night booked there because I don't think I would have been okay with staying there another one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for a Motel.”
Reviews.Author: SFtransplant
Reviews.Content: I am more of a high rise hotel person, but everything was full in San Diego due to Comic Con. The hotel room was large and the furniture was newer and in good shape. The room was clean every day and it had a large refrigerator in it. We could see the Seaworld fireworks everynight from our balcony at 10pm. Denny's is next door. The other motel guests were civilized and there did not appear to be any permanent residents. On the contrary, the bed mattress needed to be replaced, there was no microwave or in-room coffee and the towels were pretty thin. But maybe that's all you get for $109 per night. Overall I was pleased that it was not a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Tight budget & Good location”
Reviews.Author: ireneang8222
Reviews.Content: If you have a tight budget and want a short stay just for sleeping,this is not a bad choice.We booked through expedia but we were not allowed to check in within half an hour as the motel has yet to receive conformation.We were cautious of the surroundings at first,but after seeing families with children staying there,we felt relief and safe.Well,it is not within a nice neighbourhood,but the place was well gated and Hampton's INN at much higher rate is just next to it. I dont expect much form an INN and have been to better INN,but this is better than Sahara hotel that I stayed in Vegas in terms of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World, but right across a NUDE Strip Club”
Reviews.Author: xmlbox
Reviews.Content: I gave Good-Nite Inn a shot, since it was very close to Sea World. But didnt realize the neighborhood, its on the industrial side and has couple of NUDE strip clubs around/across it. It was very embarrassing to take family to this hotel. Even if you are going in a couple, you have to pass through these clubs, which does not give you a good feeling to start with. Also, after 12 there are some fishy activities going around the place - so I would say stay away from the place if you are going with kids or as a couple. I would have rather paid $30 bucks more to stay little bit far, but in a better neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommended this hotel for light sleepers!!!”
Reviews.Author: krichards89
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, and close to everything! Quiet hotel atmosphere, dark curtains to keep out sunlight, amazing sound proofed walls between each room for light sleepers, very professional staff, and overall convenience galore!! Loved our stay here!!! Thanks again!! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmanch68
Reviews.Content: Made the trip to San Diego to see my son graduate from Marine Basic Training. The hotel was only a mile from the Depot and the room was very clean. Traffic is not an issue and it was only a 10 minute drive to downtown and the marina area. Shopping is very close as well. Great value for the price. Don't look past this place when planning your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: adventure_bug1987
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was cheap and it was perfectly adequate for our stay. We were in San Diego for Comic Con, so our requirements included being close to the airport and within easy reach of the Convention Centre. The staff on the front desk were very helpful in showing us how to get to the nearest metro station (old town) on a map, which was only a 5 minute walk away. They would also happily order a taxi if we asked them to. It wasn't necessarily in the nicest of areas, nearby buildings and streets looked a little shabby and it was surrounded by strip clubs, but this wasn't a major issue as we were spending our days downtown. The room itself was large and had 2 double beds which were comfortable and provided a good night's sleep. The decor was pretty outdated, but when you only want a room for sleeping in it hardly matters. The bathroom was clean and there was always hot water. Towels were provided and would be washed and replaced if you put them out for the cleaning staff who came every day. There was a lift although it was pretty slow and didn't seem all that reliable - we never got stuck in it though. Basically don't go to this hotel if you are looking for luxury or are likely to spend a large amount of time in it, but if you just want a bed to sleep in and a shower to destinkify in, it was absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Houston_TexasMovies
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to everything including freeways. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable which is something we haven't experienced in many hotels in a long time. We had a great stay and would stay again. Denny's was right across the street for an easy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: lonsterIllinois
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to ALL attractions, and downtown San Diego. Also, best value in town, especially for single male traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you love blood on your comforter and want to be close to strip clubs!”
Reviews.Author: peachyfresca23
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at!!! We decided to save money by staying here this summer, and we immediately regretted that decision. First off, the room was never cleaned as there was dried food all over the AC unit and what seemed like dried, orange vomit on the floor next to the bed. The first night, as we pulled into the parking lot, we watched as a man escorted a prostitute into his room. Also, we were awakened at 2 a.m. by someone banging on our door, which thouroughly freaked us out. We also were frightened by the loud yelling and screaming from the room next to us. The next morning, we tried in vain to switch hotels, bu the agency we booked it through would not give us a refund. The second night, before going to bed, we discovered dried BLOOD on the bottom side of the comforter!! Being nursing students, we had seen plenty of blood before,a dn undoubtedly knew it was not a drink or any other liquid other than blood. Not only was it hidden since it was on the bottom side, it was right at the top, and the night before my friend had unknowingly covered her face with it! Since it was midnight, we took the bloody comforter to the front desk where the guy working there said he would hang onto it and told us to come back in the morning when the manager was there. At 7 the next morning, the first thing we did was go to the office to talk with the manager. Not only did she actually say that WE were the ones to bleed on the comforter, she proceeded to lie and say that she sent it to "Eco Lab" (which doesn't exist) to have it tested for blood when we asked to see the comforter to show her the stains. We argued with her for an hour, with her finally refusing to talk anymore and demanding us to leave. She was incredibly rude and never offered to do anything for us or even a simple "I'm sorry" at all. We then contacted our booking agency who were appalled to hear our story and assured us that they would contact the owner of the hotel about our dispute. We left sad that we had been treated so badly, and appalled at the conditions of the hotel. This is the most disgusting, horrid, and terrible place to stay at in San Diego. Not only are the rooms terrible, it has a horrible location (next to 2 strip clubs) and is not worth staying at. Pay the extra $20 to stay at a Best Western or something, anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for my business visit here. The location of the hotel is not bad. A few attractions are close by. The room was clean and neat. Though they do not have a proper breakfast Denny's very near by offers discounts for guests staying here. Since its a basic inn do not expect anything fancy. Not recommended for families with young kids. The big turnoff was the very unfriendly and unresponsive service. There's no one at hand. So if you need anything you need to walk back to reception everytime. The guys at the reception were very cold and were not concerned if the issue got resolved or not. In summary, not a very pleasant experience unless you plan to be here just to catch some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The value for my dollar was very good.”
Reviews.Author: sungoddess35
Reviews.Content: I loved having a fridge/freezer in the room as well as a desk with internet hook up. The shower head was good too. Check room for extra toilet paper before turning in. I ran out and had trouble with the phone calling the front desk. I was concerned about the large puddles of water in the underground garage. For a hotel that is concerned about saving water they seem to have an issue here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel -- much worth than the value”
Reviews.Author: gee_25Irvine
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel celebrating my anniversary with the husband. the place offers the best value.. good service, clean, friendly staff and worth the price. The hotel is also located near several enjoyment joints and is walking distance form the old town trolley station.. i will only stay in the same hotel when i go again..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: pilotslife
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I travelled with my business partner and we were quite comfortable in our room and were surprised at the level of service of the front desk personnel. The complimentary coffee was good and just what we needed to start a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good value”
Reviews.Author: stugo
Reviews.Content: For the price, this motel is a bargain. The room is basic but clean and quiet. There was a small refrigerator in the room which is a big plus for me. The front desk was most helpful: I asked for a shampoo that wasn't in my room; I went for a long walk and when I returned, it was there. I did not have a car and that could be a problem. The place is a 12 minute walk from the Old Town Transit Center and Old Town State Park (a great place to see if you have some free time). However, the streets are at unusual angles and difficult to cross. You should have a map the first time going there on foot. After finding the place they have a handy one-page sheet telling you how to get to most places driving or by public transportation. Not in the best neighborhood but it is right next to another, more expensive, motel. There is coffee in the lobby until 10am, but I am not a coffee drinker, so didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Good buy for the price.”
Reviews.Author: redtiger70
Reviews.Content: Needed a place last minute. I town for work. Just needed a bed. It was no frills & exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches in the bed.”
Reviews.Author: ek3737
Reviews.Content: Cheap, yes. Sleepable, no. Unless you want to sleep with roaches. My friend and I stayed here. When we got to the hotel room, there was not 1 roach in her bed, but 3!! We were freaked out. So we scanned the room and killed 9 more roaches! I decided to make sure my bed was free of roaches - i took off the comforter off- and found another one!!!!!!!!!! If you are okay with roaches, then stay here, because it is close to everything and really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere if You Want to Be in a Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: WileE21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beyond words. First of all, we had two homeless people greet us in the parking lot. One was wandering the hallways, the other had their shopping cart in the parking lot. The tub had a dead roach in it. The room was not properly cleaned and did not have toilet paper in it. When we called the front desk for more, they brought us 2 more rolls which only had maybe 1/4 of the sheets left on it. It looked like he ransacked other rooms to find some. The door molding was broken off in the bathroom. And the hotel is right across the street from a strip club. Fantastic place for families...not really! I will never stay here again. The only good thing is that the front desk staff was friendly. I feel sorry for them working in a dump like that. The owners should take better care of the facility or at least compensate the staff for putting up with such unsanitary and unsafe conditions. Hotwire thankfully refunded my money after realizing that this hotel should not be a two star hotel and took my review into consideration, therefore downgrading this to a one star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LCastilloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great location for our Sea World Trip. Room was nicely kept up. Bathrooms a little small. Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs are at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgetelectric
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bed bugs and when I told them about it. They acted as though is was no big deal. This hotel is allowing people to take the gift of bed bugs home with you.

Reviews.Title: “Find another Hotle”
Reviews.Author: skEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we had no towels, no garbage can, no glasses, the ice machine on the main level did not work and the carpet in our room was dirty beyond words.I am not a fussy person as long as the room is clean, but you did not take your shoes off in this one. I asked the maid to leave us towels, but she didn't., so I had to go to the front office to get them. I told the office staff how dirty the carpet was and they said they would have it cleaned after we left, should it not have been cleaned prior to our arrival? When I booked this hotel, I was told that they had continental breakfast, but they didn,t.

Reviews.Title: “Location Matters :Good value for $”
Reviews.Author: mussorie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time and found it above my expectation, i stayed at Motel6 earlier and the rooms were better then theirs. The location for this place is pretty close to Seaworld and so you avoid the traffic , its near to midway st which is the hub of SD shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Close and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: usdtraveler
Reviews.Content: I was on a quick trip to visit my daughter at college. I wanted a place that was close, and didn't want to spend alot of money. Check in was a snap. Parking was close to room. Room was clean and smoke free. Everything worked as expected. Will use again on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “even better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: walldogg
Reviews.Content: great value,. clean rooms, comfortable beds, polite customer service. convenient freeway access. nearby eating establishments.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Nite at the Good Nite Inn”
Reviews.Author: PWT77
Reviews.Content: The good nite inn is well lighted, lots of parking, rooms are large, the rooms are divided into smoking and non-smoking, and the staff is incredible, and the price is right, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price great stay”
Reviews.Author: monstr7201
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at the Good Nite inn it is very affordable and very conveniently located to the trolley station and the Interstate 5 freeway. The staff was very friendly and very willing to help. Housekeeping was tops. I would have liked the Inn to have some kind of security guard after hours for peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “good nite inn”
Reviews.Author: chico47SanDiego
Reviews.Content: your service was very well. i enjoy my stay and my customer service aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, and it's cheap.”
Reviews.Author: bbrenpbr
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the place to be a dump after reading the reviews but it wasn't a bad place. It was clean, cheap, and 2 blocks from the sports arena. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and great location”
Reviews.Author: chamer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Good Night Inn for 4 nights the staff was very helpful with any questions we had about the area and gave us some good advice on place to eat. It was close to the beach and sea world were we spend most of our time and overall our experiance was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Really good service and rooms, even though it is hard to get to from off the freeway.”
Reviews.Author: tehmegera
Reviews.Content: We were at Good Nite Inn for four days and three nights. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but the employee at the front desk, Chris, was very helpful when we asked questions. The room service was annoying when they kept knocking on our door since the rooms didn't have a Do Not Disturb sign. The room itself was nice, even though sometimes the toilet needed multiple flushings. The bed was comfy. The location was extremely difficult to get to when we came off the freeway, since we would have to try and get over two lanes in order to turn. What we liked best was the cheap rate we got for a pretty good hotel. What we liked least was the lack of Do Not Disturb signs.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mking85
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel its was a great choice everything was near by the staff was really helpful with locations on diffrent places my wife and i wanted to go it the room was comfortable and roomy i will stay again you cant beat the price or location at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cjh5218
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff and reasonably priced accommodations I would refer to anyone who chooses to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Diego Area.”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasSeaAngel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not luxurious but they are clean and somewhat spacious. We even had a small refridgerator, which was very helpful for our 4 night stay. The location is awesome--it is close to beaches, Seaworld, downtown, old town, etc. (10-15 minute drive). The price was definitely lower than the majority of San Diego hotels. There is a Denny's about 100 yards across the street & plenty of other places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: SeaworldFun
Reviews.Content: the price will say it all. You get what you pay for, its wasn't that bad, the only problem was the internet service connection was really bad. we stayed 2 night buy the second night we were able to connect to the internet. Room was very clean. We were able to sleep and get ready for our following day. We would probably consider on staying there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: azequestrian
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, not too bad. The only problem I saw was the shower/bath tub had some mold growing on it in the tile grout that was easily scraped off with a little elbow grease, or they could have used a commercial spray. Other than that it was an alright room since I was just using it to sleep in and nothing more. Oh Yea! The TV/Cable sucked, there were no good channels on it for me or my kids, but we didn't really have time to watch anything we were so busy at the Zoo or Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ichigomama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Good Nite Inn for 2 nights with my family and my friend's family. I enjoyed my stay, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Being across the street from a Denny's and down the street from commercial areas was a plus.The room was well kept and I had no problems with noise or views. Overall, a good place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price for the location!”
Reviews.Author: januareegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here with my 7 & 13 yr old son's for 3 nights in July. The location is amazing - really close to EVERYTHING! Not only is Seaworld less then 5 minutes away, but it is conveniently located within 5 minutes of numerous resteraunts, a Target & a Ralph's grocery store. Easy access to both the 5 & the 8 hwy's so you can get to Downtown, Mission Beach & La Jolla within 15 mins. Yes there is a Stripclub close by, but for the entire time we were there we heard no noise, loud music or fighting, if it weren't for the neon lights you see when you drive past you really wouldn't know it was there. Yes, the hotel is a little older, the carpeting isn't in the best shape, however - our room was kept very clean by the maid service, we received an abundant supply of towels upon request & there was no complaints from any of us about any odd smells or bugs as mentioned in other reviews. Although I must say that if we had seen a bug it wouldn't have surprised or horrified us - it's San Diego people - when you have perfect temps, high humidity, lots of flowers & an ocean close by you're bound to see a bug or two. The front desk help was always happy to answer our questions, give directions, recommend local restaurants, tell us about coupons & discounts to places we were headed & super friendly whenever we asked for more towels (my kids us a lot of towels lol.) I loved having the refrigerator in the room for the kids snacks & drinks & bottled water that we brought with us everywhere because it's a lot cheaper buying that stuff by the case then paying $3 a pop at some of the attractions. There's also a laundry area which we didn't think much of at first, but after 2 days of swimming in the ocean we were glad to have it so we could freshen up our beach wear & towles. Bottom line - it's not the Hilton, but if you're looking for a cheap, very conveniently located, clean hotel with a freindly staff then this is definately the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE AND GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ASHspirit2009
Reviews.Content: Nicely located off the 5 freeway, this place is worth the price! I was treated well from the moment I stepped in to the moment I left. The rooms are nice and spacious with a nice size restroom. The beds were very comfortable and cozy. I honestly recommend this place, that's why I'm heading back there tommorow. Oh yeah... YOU CAN SEE THE FIREWORKS AT SEA WORLD FROM THE BALCONY.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Jane”
Reviews.Author: LavadourWife
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not meet my expectations. They advertise wi-fi but do not tell you it costs $4.95 per day. No pool, no spa. Beds were comfortable to lay on, but if you are sleeping with someone else expect to feel their every move. Was right accross from Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Evans_ColoradoShark
Reviews.Content: We had great service and the place is within five or ten minutes away from anything you want to see in San Diego. There were problems that the motel had no control over such as a car alarm going off everey few minutes the first couple of nights but the managerment did their best to fix the problem. One un-fixable problem the motel has is Mario's Cafe which sits on the back of the motel. Unless they were just jamming for the fourth of July, this place has an idiot for an owner. They had the music system playing at the loudest it would go which made the speakers rattle and sounded horrible. They were lucky they were playing music I like or they would have had serious problems! They must not have a noise ordinance or the cops don't care which I believe is the case. The motel is safe but if you need the cops for anything other than a murder don't count on seeing them show up if you call for help. I was dissappointed we didn't get to see any pimps or asian prostitutes the whole week we were their. My wife wasn't. I was scarrier looking than any of the other patrons of the motel and a lot more dangerous!

Reviews.Title: “We love Goodnite Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: rn4kidsPhoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the three southern California locations, Chula Vista, Sea World, and Buena Park, and have always had awesome service and a great stay! I appreciate the friendliness of the staff, the rooms are comfortable for the money and the check in and out process is always smooth. If you are looking for a budget hotel and friendly service this is your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and great value!”
Reviews.Author: dwvycwmw
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and no smelling. We like the comfortable firm bed that we can have a good night sleep and clean bathroom with hot water and strong showerhead. Only one thing we think inconvenient is no hair dryer in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: pattyvalentine
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed staying at this hotel. great prices and great customer service

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cmurray56
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights in June 2009. Great value for price. safe, clean,staff are great very happy and helpfull. Close to public transport. Across the road there are various food outlets. Easy to get luggage up to 2/3 floor with the elevator. comfortable beds, great free coffee and tea. Would recommend a stay there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, very nice and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: EmmJos
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and of very good standard according to the price. The staff was very helpful and helped us out a lot with directions and car rental. We would absolutely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the price! would definatly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: travis_shawna4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to everything we wanted to be near on our trip to San Deigo. We decided to take a late honeymoon and being that we just recently had a baby we didnt really have the money to do anything too fancy but we love the ocean and everything about san diego and just wanted an inexpensive get away. This hotel definatly accomadated our budget and it was overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, it's about a 10 minute walk to Old Town, where you can easily access downtown, US/Mexico border, etc using the light rail or buses. Old Town in itself is really great. Ironically enough we never went to Sea World. We took public transit everywhere, the longest ride was to Pacific Beach, which was about 25 minutes away. There is a strip club next door, although I never saw any of the incidents described in other posts. Although for some reason there was a strange feeling I got whenever I walked around there late at night. Nothing more than a feeling, though. The Denny's on the block gives you a 10% discount on food for staying at the Good Nite. There's also an In-N-Out, Rubios and Jack in the Box within walking distance. The room was adequate and always properly cleaned. It was a little dark at night, I think it could have used higher watt bulbs or added some light, especially at the entrance to the room. Overall a great value for the price paid and the location worked out wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jg84Boston
Reviews.Content: Staff are not friendly. Before my trip I called the Hotel and they said a lot of attractions were close (walking distance). Ended up being that we had to take cabs during the whole trip. The bathroom is horrible. Taking showers was a nightmare. Weirdos walking 24/7. Very very close to strip clubs, so don'y be surprised if you see the escorts walking around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: pankaj11
Reviews.Content: I went to this place for a conference and really was worth the price. Nice place & very nice location close to all attractions & down town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dlaw5454
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent trip and the staff was very helpful!! The room was very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Good caring staff”
Reviews.Author: harry_d_vibrant
Reviews.Content: They took attention to all our needs and were careful about all our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU LIKE ASIAN ESCORT SERVICE STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: truereviewsPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I am begging whoever looks into this hotel and plan on staying there to change there mind. We stayed here last year and it was a good value for the money. THERE ARE ASIAN ESCORTS AND PIMPS WALKING ALL OVER THE GROUNDS AND HAVE ROOM 216 and 218 AND PROBABLY MORE THAT I DO NOT KNOW ABOUT. We stayed in room 214, carpet was dirty, hair on the bed, AND MUCH MORE. Me and my fiance left our room and went out to enjoy ourselves and came back around 10pm. The room next door to us was used as an escort service room the WHOLE NIGHT. We heard pimps demanding money from these Asian girls that where going in and out of the rooms until about 5 am in the morning sunday. We DID NOT sleep whatsoever. The phone didnt work in the room to even call the front desk and i wasnt about to go outside without a gun. Then around 12midnite it started getting really crazy, the pimps and these women where standing outside the room drinking and doing drugs allowing men to come in and out and me and my fiance arent stupid we knw what was going on. It was a nightmare and i will never stay here again. Please if you have kids, or even if you just need a room for 1 night get a different hotel and pay the extra 20 bucks or so. I also think the hotel is linked up and has some type of contract with the strip club thats across the street, i wouldnt be surprised. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU LIKE TO SLEEP, IF YOU ARE A CLEAN PERSON, HAVE KIDS, OR WANT TO ENJOY YOUR STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay anymore”
Reviews.Author: gerald1605
Reviews.Content: We have repeated a trip that we did last year at approximately the same time of the year - last year we were pleased because the hotel had a good value: Cost efficient even during the time of a convention and having everything one needs. Most of all it was clean. This should be most important for a hotel (I believe). Everything else is comfort and price ... but cleaningness changed dramatically since then. I do not want to overweight some bugs (may always come in especially in warm climate and I am not a specialist for what I have seen - unfortunately). But the room itself and the bathroom made a very poor impression with respect to cleaningness and also the towels should find a better laundry (besides the fact that nearly every day of our 5 day stay there was a different number missing after the room service): Not only lots of hair in many, also nice brown stripes in some could be found. They definetely lost us as a customer for next year. Minor thing: WiFi was available the same way like last year but cost extra.

Reviews.Title: “Bed, desk, internet = I'm happy”
Reviews.Author: ventoboy30
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews, my expectations were low. I stayed 4 nights in mid-March 2009. It was fine. No problems. And inexpensive! It was a convenient location for getting to my conference at a hotel that cost 4 time more. It was clean. The internet cost $5.95 per day but most of the time I rode for free on a nearby unsecured wireless signal. I did not encounter any crazies in whole time. The staff were actually friendly after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “bring a gun!”
Reviews.Author: tinkntiffo
Reviews.Content: 1. Cat Calls from men hanging outside of their hotel rooms 2. Crazed woman with terrible roots and awful grammar screaming at the front desk employee. 'MY CARD AINT WORKING RIGHT' 3. Girl wondering around talking to herself with a hood on smoking a cigarette. i pray it was a blue tooth 4. The Front Desk telling me where my cousin's room was. 5. You can hear EVERYTHING! 6. A woman screaming at 1 pm on a Sun night! 7. Walls are thin 8. My cousin stepped a belly button ring that was not vacuumed up from the previous visitor. 9. DO NOT RELY on the pull out bed. It was damp when we pulled it out! 10. There is a strip club a block away. I think they have a contract together I ended up staying next door at the safe Hampton Inn. Great accommodations Clean and Safe. Complementary Breakfast! Internet Use and you get Shampoo and soap. Pool and Spa. You will not find any of these things at the Good Night Inn. IF YOU HAVE A CHILD OR A CAR DO NOT STAY AT THE GOOD NIGHT INN! I refused to park there!

Reviews.Title: “All for Shamu! Shamu!”
Reviews.Author: shamusingapore
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (incl 2 kids of 8yrs & 10yrs) had a good comfortable stay at Goodnite Inn. The front desk receptionist attended to our needs very efficiently and ensured that we were comfortable. Altho room was basic but it offered clean & comfortable living. Won't complain for the price paid. The added advantage of this motel is the great location. Its near to places of interests..... its just a stone throw from SeaWorld, home to the great and beautiful whale called Shamu! Will definetly recommend to friends and families!!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the best area, but OK for what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Tylatoby
Reviews.Content: I'm really late in writing this review, so I wont say too much. My friend and I were looking for a cheap place to stay in San Diego...and that's exactly what we got. The hotel was nothing to write home about (except if you want to tell people about the strip club across the street). But in a way that was OK because we were just there to shower and sleep. However, the area the hotel is in doesnt look like it would be the safest, and we would have to admit when coming back to the hotel late at night we were sometimes a little scared. Totally unfounded though. All in all we got what we paid for. I wouldn't go back mostly because it wasn't in an area that had anything going on except fast food restaurants and strip clubs. It's nice being able to walk around the area near your hotel...but not here! Not a "touristy" area by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Stay near a strip club!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richandfamily
Reviews.Content: This was an absolute nightmare. Nothing like having to explain to my 7 year old son why that building across the street from the hotel says "nude girls" and "nudie cuties." My wife wasn't exactly crazy about it either... So what comes with a hotel right across the street from a strip club? That's right- strange men and women lurking in the parking lot (which, by the way, is WAY too small and filled up every night by 8:00 pm). Your other option is to park in the underground garage- which is an ominous and dark, desolate place with only one way in or out, and you'll feel like there is about a 40 percent chance that you won't make it out alive. And the rooms- fairly clean, but for the cigarette-burned holes in the comforter, the tv with no remote control, and the very strange men lurking around at all hours of the night (see strip club comments, above). Don't stay here- ever!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: psairbear89
Reviews.Content: Great experience! Low price, free breakfast, and super-friendly people! (I needed a printer, and the front-desk attendent was more than willing to help me out) Location is great too. We were able to jump right on the freeway, allowing us to be only minutes away from San Diego's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “nice...”
Reviews.Author: lottiandjohn
Reviews.Content: No problem with the hotel at all, the staff were very friendly however did feel a little bit ripped off by the location. Made out that it was easy to find and close to seaworld, we spent over 3 hours trying to find it and stopped at over 10 places to ask if people knew where it was. This is a lot of time wasting when you are only in sandiego 2 days. We did find it eventually tucked away in a random unknown area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!! What's everyone complaining about?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Needing*a*vacation
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what everyone's complaining about here? My husband, son and I just stayed here a week ago and for what we paid, this hotel exceeded our expectations! Sure, the guy at the front desk was a little greasy looking, and had tattoos, but he was super helpful and very friendly! There was also another girl working in the morning who was very nice! I've stayed at ritzy hotels with classy looking staff that just ended up being snobby, so I was quite happy here! There's a Denny's and a Jack in the Box right across the street. You get 10% off your bill at Denny's if you tell them you're staying here so that was a nice bonus. There's a big mall very close by that's definitely handy for picking up any necessities, or any food you might want to get. Although the area does seem a little shady (strip club near by) we felt very safe there. There is a train station about a 10 minute walk away which was also very handy! My only real complaint about this place was that yes, the walls were thin and we could hear the water running in the other rooms, but other than that it did the trick! I'm really shocked that for the very minimal price you pay for this hotel, people complain about the fact that the ground is stained from the a/c, or that there's a strip club around the corner! For what we paid, we were very happy and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “For sleeping and showering only not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: maliaismyname
Reviews.Content: My family and I (me, hubs and 2 young boys) recently stayed in the good nite inn at seaworld. The outside is in serious need of a renovation. We came in the middle of the night and there was nowhere to park, except for the seedy underground garage. Before stepping onto the elevator there was a huge puddle of liquid (lets hope it was water) that you had to walk through. Walked to our room which had a view of a kitchen appliance dealership and a junkyard. The ground of the hotel had so many stains from the antifreeze of the air conditioners. To our surprise the room was immaculately clean. The room was spaciious for all of us. The walls were pretty thin so we could hear our neighbors shower or sink on and off. No kid channels. Gets humid in the room. This hotel is approxiametly 15 minutes from sea world. No shuttles. They do have a excellent delivery service in the area. I forgot to mention its block away from the body shop strip joint, adult shop. As I mentioned before not kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: FOODTRAVELANDFUN
Reviews.Content: Location close to restaurants, pharmacies, coffee shops. I was worried at first due to the past reviews, but I was quite surprise that my stay there with my cousin was very pleasant. We stayed on the third floor, the beds and pillows were comfortable. It was an old and dark room, but it was still okay especially for the price that we paid. Friday and Saturday night parking can be difficult as there are a lot of cars parked due to the adult entertainment complex just across the street, but no need to be alarmed. Motel employees were very friendly and helpful. Other hotels and motels are more expensive around the area, but this place was decent and I would stay there again since I'm only there to sleep. Over all, not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, small bathroom/shower”
Reviews.Author: lacrolix
Reviews.Content: Have traveled since '05 to visit friends that live in San Diego and attend Comic-con. Normally stayed with friends but this time we chose to stay @ a hotel. 2 mid 20's single guys, 1 room with 2 bed set up. We didn't occupy the rooms during the day much as we were busy with San Diego/Comic-con. Hotel advertised free wireless internet. I called about 2 weeks before our trip date to confirm that the wireless net was there and the woman I talked to reassured me that "all rooms" have wireless access. Reason I asked is we both own laptops with wireless network cards and at the time were deciding whether to bring them or not. We flew from Seattle, Wash. and carrying a laptop can be a cumbersome with airport security plus always that risk of it getting damaged or stolen during travel. We brought our laptops on our trip to find that the room we were assigned had no wireless connectivity. The room was on the ground floor near the main office/lobby area. I asked about it and was told that whoever I talked to was misinformed and that wireless internet access only could be obtained from the main lobby. My other complaint is the bathtub/shower I felt was abnormally small. I will not lie, my travel partner and I are big guys. 6'3 and 250-300 lbs. Showering was a huge hassle for us. Very narrow and cramped space. (no, we did not shower together XD ) Beds were comfy, pillows a bit flat. On the 3rd night of our 7 day stay we requested extra pillows and bath towels to deal with our water mess from showering, which we got from the main lobby. An old A/C unit was in the room and it worked great when we used it. We requested non-smoking room, unfortunately there was a slight stale odor of cigarette smoke to our room. I did leave a few dollar bills and some spare change that we accquired from using the Trolley on our table in the room during the stay and it never went missing. We did however keep our laptops out of plain sight and under lock and key in our lugguage when not occupying the room. Hotel is near a XXX strip club but that didnt bug us. It was pretty calm and quiet during the nights. Overall other than the shower/bathtub issue the hotel is not bad for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Mokuola
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conveniently near the I5 exit. This was a family vacation so we rserved 6 rooms. We were given rooms next to each other. The rooms were clean and warm and felt good since outside was very cold. The free internet access was a plus. The bathroom toilet was leaking a little. I called front desk and they were going to send someone, who never showed. But it was a minor leak and I threw towels on the ground anyway. It wasn't a big deal. For the price and location, I was very pleased. I would definitely stay here again and tell others to stay here too. Although I heard about the Adult bar across the street, my family didn't even notice it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst worst worst”
Reviews.Author: JayMaeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend's mom came to visit from England and booked the Goodnite Inn Seaworld through a travel agent. I live in San Diego but have never heard of this hotel. And now I know why. We drove to a terrible neighborhood in San Diego. Dirty, bums everywhere, cops patrolling the streets and the best part...a strip club right next door. We walked in to the front desk and it was disgusting. Smoky and low-class. The front desk attendant was covered in tattoos and looked like he was just released from prison. I was adament that we leave and get a refund. I would not let my worst enemy stay at that hotel much less my boyfriend's mother. We left and they are still working out the refund. I hate that this was her first impression of San Diego. Please don't stay here, you will definitely regret it.

Reviews.Title: “laptop stolen out of room - beware”
Reviews.Author: mspusch
Reviews.Content: this place is in a bad neibourhood. the corridors are accessible from the outside and there are no surveillance cameras. there are not enough parking spots outside in front of the hotel and there is a free (and dark) garage, again without surveillance cameras and accessible from the outside. we were there with our company for a conference and had three rooms. one was broken into thru the window during the first day and a laptop and a portable printer were stolen. the hotel insurance does not cover theft by third party, and the hotel management even denied the request to at least not charge for the room. so overall bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: makkar
Reviews.Content: My car window was broken at night and my wife's purse stolen from the car when it was parked at hotel basement parking. The incident was reported to Hotel staff but they were not very responsive and it seemed that they were aware of it and also aware of who did it. When I asked them to check the camera tapes to see who has done it, they said it won't be possible to see in video since camera is facing only entry and exit points. Well, I believe they could have easily seen who did it by checking who is leaving with my wife's purse but they didn't seem interested in that. When I asked hotel staff does this happen quite often, and the response was that it has happened in the past as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Good Nite Inn Sea World
HotelInfo.Address: 3880 Greenwood Street, San Diego, CA 92110
